sen.j: 北畠 教具（きたばたけ のりとも、応永30年（1423年）- 文明 (日本)3年3月23日 (旧暦)（1471年4月13日））は、室町時代中期の公卿。
sen.e: Noritomo KITABATAKE (1423 - April 13, 1471 (the old calendar)) was a kugyo (court noble) in the middle of the Muromachi period.
Noritomo KITABATAKE (1423-April 13, 1471) was a Kugyo (court noble) lived in the middle of the Muromachi period.
sen.cmt: 公卿を単語調査に従い大文字にしました。"lived"を加えました。
sen.e: Noritomo KITABATAKE (1423-April 22, 1471) was a Kugyo (court noble) lived in the middle of the Muromachi period.
sen.cmt: グレゴリオ歴に変更しました。

sen.j: 伊勢国司北畠家の第4代当主で、伊勢国の守護大名でもある。
sen.e: He was the fourth family head of the Kitabatake family, Ise Kokushi (an officer of Ise Province) and was a shugo daimyo (provincial military governor that became daimyo, Japanese feudal loard)

He was the fourth family head of the Kitabatake family whose members served as Ise Kokushi (an officer of Ise Province) for generations, as well as the Shugo daimyo (provincial military governor that became daimyo, Japanese feudal lord) of Ise Province.
sen.cmt: ピリオドが抜けています。少々わかりづらい箇所を書き換えました。
sen.e: He was the fourth family head of the Kitabatake family whose members served as Ise Kokushi (an officer of Ise Province) for generations, as well as the Shugo daimyo (provincial military governor that became daimyo, Japanese feudal lord) of Ise Province.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.e: Son of Mitsumasa KITABATAKE
He was the son of Mitsumasa KITABATAKE
sen.cmt: 文が不完全です。
sen.e: He was the son of Mitsumasa KITABATAKE
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 19歳で伊勢国司となり、将軍の足利義教から一字を賜って教具と名乗った。
sen.e: When he was 19 years old, he became an Ise Kokushi (an officer of Ise Province) and was given a letter from the shogun Yoshinori ASHIKAGA and identified himself as Noritomo.

He assumed the post of Ise Kokushi at age 19, and bore the name of Noritomo (教具 in Chinese characters) by being given a Chinese character "教" from the shogun Yoshinori ASHIKAGA (足利義教 in Chinese characters): to be granted a character of master's name was honor in those days.
sen.cmt: わかりづらいので説明を加え，書き換えました。
sen.e: He assumed the post of Ise Kokushi at age 19, and bore the name of Noritomo (教具 in Chinese characters) by being given a Chinese character "教" from the shogun Yoshinori ASHIKAGA (足利義教 in Chinese characters): to be granted a character of master's name was honor in those days.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 嘉吉元年（1441年）、嘉吉の乱が起こると、伊勢国に逃亡してきた赤松教康（赤松満祐の子）を殺害して、幕府に恭順を誓った。
sen.e: When the Kakitsu War occurred in 1441, he killed Noriyasu AKAMATSU (son of Mitsusuke AKAMATSU) who excaped from Ise Province and showed deference to bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun).

When the Kakitsu War occurred in 1441, he killed Noriyasu AKAMATSU (the son of Mitsusuke AKAMATSU), who had escaped inside of Ise Province, to show his deference to bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun).
sen.cmt: 「伊勢国に逃亡」なので訂正し，書き換えました。
sen.e: When the Kakitsu War occurred in 1441, he killed Noriyasu AKAMATSU (the son of Mitsusuke AKAMATSU), who had escaped inside of Ise Province, to show his deference to bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun).
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 文安5年（1448年）に長野工藤氏と所領を巡り合戦を行っている。
sen.e: In 1448, he had a fight with the Naganokudo family for the territory.
In 1448, he had a fight with the Naganokudo family over the territory.
sen.cmt: 前置詞for をover に換えました。
sen.e: In 1448, he had a fight with the Naganokudo family over the territory.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 宝徳3年（1451年）に正四位、参議に叙任。
sen.e: In 1451 he was conferred to Shoshii (Senior Fourth Rank) and Sangi.
In 1451, he was conferred to Shoshii (Senior Fourth Rank) and appointed to Sangi (councilor).
sen.cmt: 参議の説明が必要と思われます。官位の正四位と，役職の参議では動詞を変える必要があると考えます。
sen.e: In 1451, he was conferred to Shoshii (Senior Fourth Rank) and appointed to Sangi (councilor).
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 翌年正月には従三位に叙任。
sen.e: In the new year of the next year, he was conferred to the Jusanmi (Junior Third Rank).
On January 31, 1452, he was conferred to the Jusanmi (Junior Third Rank).
sen.cmt: 「翌年正月」を新暦に直しました。
sen.e: On January 31, 1452, he was conferred to the Jusanmi (Junior Third Rank).
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 享徳2年（1453年）に正二位に叙任。
sen.e: In 1453, he was conferred to Shonii (Senior Second Rank).
In 1453, he was conferred to Shonii (Senior Second Rank).
sen.cmt: 修正なし
sen.e: In 1453, he was conferred to Shonii (Senior Second Rank).
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 康正2年（1456年）3月に権中納言に叙任。
sen.e: In March 1456, he was conferred to Gon Chunagon (a provisional vice-councilor of state).
In March 1456, he was appointed to Gon Chunagon (a provisional vice-councilor of state).
sen.cmt: 権中納言は役職名なのでappointの方がよいのではと考えました。
sen.e: In March 1456, he was appointed to Gon Chunagon (a provisional vice-councilor of state).
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 長禄2年（1458年）には従二位に叙任する。
sen.e: In 1458 he was conferred to Junii (Junior Second Rank).
In 1458, he was conferred to Junii (Junior Second Rank).
sen.cmt: 年号のあとにコンマを追加しました。
sen.e: In 1458, he was conferred to Junii (Junior Second Rank).
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 応仁元年（1467年）の応仁の乱では、戦火を逃れて伊勢にやってきた足利義視を保護している。
sen.e: In the Onin war in 1467, he protected Yoshimi ASHIKAGA who escaped from the fires of war and came to Ise.
In the Onin war in 1467, he harbored Yoshimi ASHIKAGA, who came to Ise province after being saved from the war.
sen.cmt: 「戦火を逃れて」と「保護」に別の訳をあてました。伊勢を伊勢国とし書き換えました。
sen.e: In the Onin war in 1467, he harbored Yoshimi ASHIKAGA, who came to Ise province after being saved from the war.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: この合戦で北畠氏は東軍についたが、教具は足利義政から上洛を許されず大和国長谷寺にいて洛中の戦闘には参加していない。
sen.e: In this war, the Kitabatake clan took the side of east army, but Noritomo was not allowed to go to Kyoto by Yoshimasa ASHIKAGA and stayed at the Hasedera temple in Yamato Province and did not participate in the war.

The Kitabatake clan entered the war on the 'eastern' army side, but Noritomo, who was staying in Hasedera Temple at that time, did not participate in the war unfolded inside the capital, because Yoshimasa ASHIKAGA prohibited him from going to the capital.
sen.cmt: 少々わかりづらいので書き換えました。
sen.e: The Kitabatake clan entered the war on the 'eastern' army side, but Noritomo, who was staying in Hasedera Temple at that time, did not participate in the war unfolded inside the capital, because Yoshimasa ASHIKAGA prohibited him from going to the capital.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 応仁2年（1468年）2月、伊勢守護土岐政康が入国するとこれを攻め、林崎・若松・柳・楠原の諸城を落としている。
sen.e: When Masayasu TOKI, Govenor of Ise Province entered the province in February 1468, he attacked his army and conquered the Hayashizaki, Wakamatsu, Yanagi and Kusubaru castles.

When Masayasu TOKI, Shugo (Military Governor) of Ise Province entered the province in February 1468, Noritomo attacked Masayasu TOKI's troops and conquered the castles of the Wakamatsu, Yanagi and Kusubaru clans.
sen.cmt: 少々わかりづらいので書き換えました。守護は単語登録から引用しました。
sen.e: When Masayasu TOKI, Shugo (Military Governor) of Ise Province entered the province in February 1468, Noritomo attacked Masayasu TOKI's troops and conquered the castles of the Wakamatsu, Yanagi and Kusubaru clans.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 文明 (日本)元年（1469年）8月に権大納言に叙任。
sen.e: In August 1469, he was conferred to Gon Chunagon.
In August 1469, he was appointed to Gon Chunagon.
sen.cmt: 権中納言は役職名なのでappointの方がよいのではと考えました。
sen.e: In August 1469, he was appointed to Gon Dainagon (a provisional chief councilor of state).
sen.cmt: 権中納言→権大納言Gon Dainagon (provisional chief councilor of state)としました。

sen.j: 文明2年（1470年）には北上し、三重郡・朝明郡にも進出した。
sen.e: He moved toward the north in 1470 and entered into Mie Country and Asake Country.
He started moving northward in 1470, and reached as far as Mie Country and Asake Country.
sen.cmt: 少々わかりづらいので書き換えました。
sen.e: He started moving northward in 1470, and reached as far as Mie Country and Asake Country.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 文明3年（1471年）3月23日、伊勢で死去した。
sen.e: He died in Ise in March 23, 1471.
He died in Ise Province on March 23, 1471.
sen.cmt: 伊勢を伊勢国とし書き換えました。前置詞をonに換えました。
sen.e: He died in Ise Province on April 22, 1471.
sen.cmt: グレゴリオ歴に変更して、最初の日付と合わせました。

sen.e: The age at death was 49.
He was 49 years old when he died.
sen.cmt: 少々わかりづらいので書き換えました。
sen.e: He was 49 years old when he died.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 死因は腫物であったようである。
sen.e: Tumor seemed to be the cause of death.
It is believed that he succumbed to tumor.
sen.cmt: 少々わかりづらいので書き換えました。
sen.e: It is believed that he succumbed to tumor.
sen.cmt: 修正なし
